strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: This is Tryan Gully, where...
<se_def>*: ...humans and elves and...
<se_def>*: ...monsters all live together, haargh!
<se_high>*: When I was little, I nearly fell down to the bottom of the gully. I did! It's true!
<se_high>*: But my friend swooped down and saved me! He caught me as I was falling! He's a dracky, you know.
<se_high>*: You're a monster, too. Monsters are cool!
<se_high>*: If the Lord of Darkness manages to escape his seal...
<se_high>*: ...every living thing on earth will either be destroyed or turned into a shadow. Humans, monsters AND elves.
<se_high>*: We cannot allow Rhapthorne to return. We must all work together now, not fight each other!
<se_def>*: Poor Raya cried her eyes out when she heard David was dead.
<se_def>*: He was an heir of the great sage Kupas, you know. But we'll never see him again. It's so sad.
<se_low>*: Aaaargh! (Creak)
<se_low>*: Gwaaaah! A new face! And an old-looking one to boot!
<se_low>*: (Creak)
<se_def>*: Rhapthorne is the Lord of Darkness, ruler of the World of Darkness. But for all his might, he could not control his lust for power.
<se_def>*: He came here to the World of Light thinking he could reign over that, too.
<se_def>*: But he was stopped by the seven great sages. They sealed him away in a huge rock somewhere in our world.
<se_high>*: Ooooh! You're a fine-looking specimen, aren't you!? How about a kiss?
<se_high>*: Slow down! I was only joking! Oh, men are all the same!
<se_high>*: No!? Typical! You men are all the same! If it isn't a puff-puff, you're not interested!
<se_low>*: Everyone here in Tryan Gully hid the fact that David was an heir of one of the great sages. Raya swore us to secrecy.
<se_low>*: She said he should only be told once he was old enough to understand. And now this has happened. It's terrible...
<se_low>*: It was many, many years ago now that Kupas helped Raya and I.
<se_low>*: I can't even remember exactly when it was, it was so long ago.
<se_low>*: But I'll never forget the debt of gratitude I owe him. As long as I live, I'll do everything I possibly can for Kupas and his heirs.
<se_low>*: If you want to experience Kupas's compassion for yourself, take a good look at the picture at the back of the room.
<se_def>*: The Godbird Empyrea and the seven human sages had to use all their might to seal away Rhapthorne.
<se_def>*: If he were to return, it would be impossible to destroy him. He must be stopped now, before it is too late.
<se_def>*: They say somewhere in the world there's a castle built by Rhapthorne.
<se_def>*: But people have looked all over for it and never found it. It's a bit strange...

<se_def>*: Tryan Gully was the dream of the great sage Kupas.<page>*: A place where humans, elves and monsters could live together in peace, never forgetting the threat posed by Rhapthorne, should he ever return.
<se_def>*: Everyone here knows all too well about Rhapthorne and his evil ways. Just ask around if you want to know more about him.
<se_high>*: I am an elf. My name is Raya. You know, there used to be a young man called David who lived here in the valley.
<se_high>Raya: But he went off on his travels, never to return. He was murdered, you see.<page>Raya: Murdered before he could learn the truth about his ancestry; that he was the heir of a great sage.
<se_high>Raya: I tell you this only because... Well, it's very strange, but I can sense David's presence within you.
<se_high>Raya: Did you perhaps encounter each other somewhere along your journey?
<se_high>Raya: No? Then I wonder where this strange feeling comes from.
<se_high>Raya: Perhaps the grief of his loss is clouding my judgement... I have found it very hard to bear... Please, forget I mentioned it.
<se_high>Raya: You were at David's side during his final moments!? Then surely it cannot be a coincidence that you're here now.
<se_high>Raya: You witnessed the dying moments of the heir of a great sage, and now you're visiting his home here in Tryan Gully! It must mean something!
<se_high>Raya: I'm afraid I must ask you a favour. I have no one else to turn to now.
<se_high>Raya: Rhapthorne, the Lord of Darkness, is close to reawakening. But he can still be stopped. And you are the <IF_SOLO>one<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>ones<ENDIF_SOLO> who must stop him.

<se_high>Raya: If he returns, our world will be enveloped by darkness in the blink of an eye.<page>Raya: For hundreds of years we have cherished but one dream. That Rhapthorne never be allowed to resume his reign of terror.
<se_high>Raya: Will you turn our dream into a reality? Please. Say you will try.
<se_high>Raya: Of course. I understand. It is too great a burden.
<se_high>Raya: All we can do is remain here in this valley and wait, then. Wait for our saviour to arrive.
<se_high>Raya: I am sure I can feel David's presence in you. The feeling of a great sage's heir is unmistakable.
<se_high>Raya: Allow me to ask you again. Have you ever met David before on your travels?
<se_high>Raya: I feel sure that can't be. Please, search deep within your memories and try to remember.
<se_high>Raya: David was a young man, with boundless compassion for others. Do you not remember him? I feel sure you must have met.

<se_high>Raya: There is but one way to stop Rhapthorne's foul ambitions. Long ago he was imprisoned by the power of a sceptre.<page>Raya: Now that sceptre must be returned to the magic circle that once held it.
<se_high>Raya: Your task is set, <IF_SOLO>saviour<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>saviours<ENDIF_SOLO>! We shall be here in the valley, awaiting your news.
<se_low>*: This is the treasure chamber. You may not enter without Raya's permission. Please leave.
<se_low>*: I've heard all about you. You're our last hope. Take whatever you need from in here.
<se_low>*: Kupas left us a Darktree leaf. When placed on a map, it points to the location of the greatest evil in the world.<page>*: It will lead you to the black soul of Rhapthorne.
<se_high>*: I'm Drang!
<se_high>Drang: I carved the picture of the dracky at the entrance of the gully. It's not bad, is it? Even if I do say so myself.
<se_high>Drang: I carved the picture of the dracky at the entrance of the gully. It's not bad, is it? Even if I do say so myself.
<se_high>*: Hey! Did you see it!? The other day, when the sky suddenly all went red!
<se_high>*: I know something about that! I heard someone say it was a sign that the Lord of Darkness is coming!
<se_high>*: It's the end. We'll all either be destroyed by Rhapthorne, or turned into shadows. One or the other.
<se_high>*: If I'm lucky and I'm just turned into a shadow, I won't look any different to a normal dracky!
<se_def>*: Raya knew. She told us it was David and the other heirs who were keeping the world at peace.
<se_def>*: But it's all too late now. We can't do anything. It's the end...
<se_low>*: Aaaargh! (Creak)
<se_low>*: For many a long year humans have been lazy. And that Godbird. But their time is up now...
<se_low>*: Aaaargh! (Creak)
<se_def>*: It's no use struggling now. Better just get <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> a drink and wait for the end.
<se_high>*: What!? Why!? How can Rhapthorne be coming back now!? In my lifetime! Oh, no!
<se_low>*: The great sage Kupas taught us that we must never allow Rhapthorne to be resurrected.<page>*: There is no way to overpower him once he has returned to his physical form.
<se_low>*: But it's too late now. It is utterly impossible to defeat the Lord of Darkness.
<se_high>Drang: I carved the picture of the dracky at the entrance of the gully.
<se_high>Drang: The Lord of Darkness will be overcome with fear when he sees it, so he'll think twice before he comes into the valley!
<se_def>*: The Godbird Empyrea and the seven human sages had to use all their might to seal away Rhapthorne.
<se_def>*: Now that he's come back, there's nothing that can be done. There's nowhere to hide. Not a single place in the entire world is safe now.
<se_def>*: The castle in the sky was made by the Lord of Darkness. He built it here in the World of Light many years ago.
<se_def>*: People say there's a whole city of passageways inside. And they're filled with illusions to confuse people.<page>*: But no one has ever entered it and returned.
<se_high>Raya: I have been waiting for you, <IF_SOLO>saviour<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>saviours<ENDIF_SOLO>. It seems Rhapthorne has finally awakened in our World of Light.
<se_high>Raya: I place no blame on you. I know that you have done everything in your power to protect us from this.
<se_high>Raya: But not one heir of the great sages remains now.

<se_high>Raya: All that is left for us to do is wait.<page>Raya: Wait for a brave soul to appear on the horizon, with the courage and strength to oppose the Lord of Darkness as the great sages did in the past.
<se_high>Raya: Let us pray together. Let us pray for a true saviour to come to our aid.
<se_high>Raya: I have come to realise...

<se_high>Raya: I have come to know just how brave the seven great sages were.<page>Raya: They were mere mortals and they were few, but they stood between the mighty Rhapthorne, and his objective, the World of Light.
<se_high>Raya: And in the face of such bravery, even the might of Rhapthorne is not so irresistible, the invulnerable flesh, not so invulnerable.<page>Raya: That is what the great sages taught me.
<se_low>*: Kupas told me this. He said that if the Lord of Darkness was to somehow return...
<se_low>*: ...the Godbird Empyrea would give great courage to those of the World of Light so they could oppose him.
<se_def>*: All the monsters here know all too well about Rhapthorne and his evil ways. Ask any one of them and they'll tell you all about him.
<se_def>*: Though, if truth be told, they haven't got anything particularly useful to say.
<se_def>*: I'd say a cocktail would be more useful to you at the moment! At least it calms the nerves, doesn't it <IF_MALE>sir<ELSE_NOT_MALE>miss<ENDIF_MALE>!?
